Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: zima1980
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and run down. This is NOT a 4-star hotel. However it has own parking, low priced, not far from the subway and nice breakfast. Also very friendly receptionst.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mick B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the hotel and were very happy. The staff were friendly and very helpful, especially when we booked our return journey to the airport. The rooms were very clean and the beds, although hard, were comfortable, and the linen was changed daily. The breakfast menu, although limited in choice, was good and plentiful. Only a 10-minute walk to the shops and metro/buses, so very easy to get to anywhere in Rome. It is really only a 3-star, not 4, but we would still recommend it for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for weekend visit”
Reviews.Author: Brian H
Reviews.Content: Located out of town but only 10 minute walk from Metro ( approx. six stops / 20 mins.to city centre ) Would class as 2 star not 4 star. Rooms basic and clean. Staff friendly except barman where everthing was an effort to serve. Bar hours are very limited told not opening until 7 pm but opened at times to suit him. Breakfast definately two star no hot food. Were advised on a previous Tripadvisor review to use a restaurant ( L'Antica Torre ) located behind Esso petrol station at top of road ( turn right out of hotel and walk for 5 mins. ) excellent food and value. Do not visit the cafe across the road 2 beers and 1 toasted sandwich 17.5 euro's a rip-off !!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: blueandwhitehoops
Reviews.Content: We had a deal at this hotel and for the money we paid it was passable. The rooms were very clean,towels and sheets changed daily. The beds were a little on the hard side but I find this a common trait in Europe. Breakfast was nothing to write home about not a look forward to at all, we tried it on the first day then took our custom to Gregory's Bar across the road that served fab coffee and lush panninis. There is a lovely and reasonable restaurant behind the Esso Garage that we ate at a couple of nights definitely recommend. There are a few restaurants and bars if you walk to the top of the road and turn right towards the Metro so if you have been out in the City all day and did not want to go back in to eat there are plenty of options locally. The Metro is convenient and there are plenty of buses too. We took a taxi bak to Leonardo Da Vinci airport that was booked by the hotel and it came to a reasonable 45 Euros. I would probably try and stay a bit closer to the centre when I come back but I had a really enjoyable time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: mazzy43
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean the staff was friendly I stayed there for 3 nights breakfast was filling I would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Four star in drag!”
Reviews.Author: June H
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels around the world, 3, 4 and 5 star. This hotel should no way be rated any higher than two stars. It is dated, shabby and grubby with very little in the way of creature comforts or amenities. The double beds are two rock hard twin mattresses placed together on a wooden box, made with ripped sheets, two single blankets, thin pillows (1 each) and a darned bed cover. The rooms have stained walls, ceilings, damaged floors, a small old Grundig TV that didn't work, single glazed windows over a very busy/noisy road, no tea/coffee, no WiFi. The hand towels were linen tea towels, the toilet seat wasn't fitted correctly, cigarette burn on the bath, green taps, and a leaking pipe that nobody wanted to fix, so, a constant drip, drip, during the night joined the traffic noise whilst we lay on a hard uncomfortable bed unable to sleep. The restaurant resembled a school canteen with wooden chairs, dirty walls, a barred fire exit and many pieces of hand written reserved signs on tables for hordes of students who occupied the lower floors. Breakfast was hard rolls, processed cheese and ham, watery juice from a machine with a drip tray that didn't bare investigation. The public toilet outside the restaurant had no locks on the cubicle doors, broken tiles from the walls on the floor under the sink and like the rest of the hotel was in need of a good clean. The whole hotel was badly in need of refurbishing and I would recommend you avoid it at all costs.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Stockton on the Forest, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “No way is it a 4star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carole J
Reviews.Content: On arrival you are informed there is a "room tax" to pay at the end of your stay - 3euros per person per night.The hotel is clean and staff quite friendly. Breakfast was very poor - Sliced cheese, sliced ham, cereals and bread. Hotel is approx 700-800mtrs from the nearest metro line.It is about 15-20 mins bus ride into the centre of Rome. It takes 40 mins by taxi from Flumicino airport. Did not eat in the restaurant in the evening as we were told it was only for "Groups". The bar opened at 6:30pm and closed any time after 10pm. There is no entertainment. There was no internet access in the rooms, but it was available in the lounge. There is an empty out side swimmng pool, which did not appear to have been used this year.Bus and metro tickets are available at any tobacconist shop, not at the hotel. There is an excellent Chinese restaurant approx 300 mtrs from hotel which is superb and very reasonably priced. The hotel needs a complete revamp to live up to a 4star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as bad as the reviews say!”
Reviews.Author: cooperxWiltshire
Reviews.Content: I was concerned after reading the reviews on here, but we returned home today after 3 nights as a family of 5 adults having had a lovely time. the hotel is not a 4 star due to being in need of a revamp, however it was clean and tidy, with towels changed and maid service everyday. We slept well and it was quiet at night and we love a firm mattress so that was great! The breakfast was basic, but I bet most people at home don't eat a huge variety everyday and it was enough to set you up for a few hours before sampling the many treats Rome offers throughout the day. The staff were very helpful with excellent english and pointed us in the direction of a fantastic restaurant just 10 minutes walk away up on the main road behind a esso garage (ok, this doesn't sound ideal but once behind the esso garage the restaurant is great) the food was amazing and the staff very helpful in explaining the menu, we ended up eating there all 3 nights as the trip back into town after a long day sightseeing was a bit much, and it was much cheeper than the centre of Rome. there is a bus - route 46 that is well documented in the hotel and takes you all the way to the Collosseum passing the Vatican so you can get off and see everything within a short walk from the bus, we did walk back from the Vatican one day but it took 45 minutes and we are fit so the average person would take longer and it may be a bit far.You can get bus tickets - Big ticket which covers metro and bus all day for 4euros or 11 euros for 3 days. all in all we had a great time and found the hotel more than fine, however if we return we would stay closer to the centre of Rome. this brings me onto location of the hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! No heat! the pictures lie!”
Reviews.Author: SLee4
Reviews.Content: We are staying here right now, and they have no heat, but no one told us. Also, the place is clean, but old and outdated. The only thing good is the breakfast. This would be a 2 star by American standards. I wish I could get my money back and go elsewhere. Definitely putting a damper on a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star establishment”
Reviews.Author: Phil04
Reviews.Content: This hotel was advertised as a four star establishment which it definatley was not ! It was more like a two star. Also this hotel is some way from the centre of Rome - 20 miniutes by bus.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel at all!”
Reviews.Author: GusBrazil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not that bad but for sure is not a 4 star hotel. The location is good (very close for the subway and bus station), the breakfeast is ok, there is a (old) elevator, and the lobby looks like to be organized but... 1) The air conditioning works only when the reception decides to do it... we had to ask several times... 2) Internet is not an option, EUR 5,00 per 2 hours! In my next travel I've decided to stay only in chains hotels that I will be sure about what to find!!!

Reviews.Title: “I wasn't impressed and I do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Polli12
Reviews.Content: Well, I'm a pretty easy going traveler and I'm used to traveling on a budget but I did not not like this hotel. The staff was rude to my husband and my father and creepy to my sister and I. They could not find our reservation that we had made weeks in advance and were actually giving my husband a hard time about it! The rooms were so, so, so old looking and our shower flooded. The neighborhood was not very good (there were bars on the apartments and graffiti on the walls as we walked through it) and it was not very central either. On the bright side, breakfast was surprisingly good and the breakfast room was actually really nice. Also there is this amazing little Italian bakery right next to it that has delicious traditional pastries and really good gelato. Also, the bus stop was really conveniently close even though the bus ride was about 15 minutes into the city center. If I could do it again, I would stay stay in a nicer more central area in a 2-star hotel...probably would be nicer than this place. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: colmau
Reviews.Content: The floor and new Bath room suite is the good aspect of this hotel. The hotel is away from the city which is good for some. Good transport link tp city once you know the way around. The laminated floor noise from above in the room below is very noisy. The T.V was a very old 14" model with poor picture quality. A double bed is made up of two singles put together. Breakfast every day was Cornflakes; bread roll cheese or ham slices. hot and cold drinks. No kettle for hot drinks in the room. The door frame in the bath room was hanging off the wall in most places. This should be rated a 2 Star hotel. excursion coaches pick up at the rear of the hotel and as there is no Air Con between 03:00 until 16:00 hrs you sleep with the window open and get all the bus noise in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel claims to be a four star Hotel, I don't think so...”
Reviews.Author: classiccarman
Reviews.Content: The young lady on reception was brilliant, the guys were not... Room was ok, just. Location was well away from anywhere you would want to visit, and the amenities were not much to go by either, eg; the swimming pool was empty and looked as if it had been for a long time. Not really any best points. Worst point was being served a 'continental' breakfast ie; cold ham, cheese and bread & tea, coffee and an assortment of awful fruit juices when what was on our booking form was a FULL BREAKFAST...

Reviews.Title: “Very good value!”
Reviews.Author: jenkk1987
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews about the hotel before my visit, I began to dread just what the hotel was going to be like. However I need not have worried. Granted it is not a modern hotel but our room was very clean and spacious. There was a small mini bar in the room and our sheets and towels were changed everyday. The curtains were layered and kept out the sunlight brilliantly. Breakfast was typically european with a wide range of cereals, pastries, spreads, cheese, cold meats and bread rolls with a good choice of fresh juice or tea/ coffee. It is not right in the centre of rome however it is only 5mins away from the vatican on the metro, and the public transport links are brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Value of money”
Reviews.Author: dimitris77
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Marc Aurelio for three nights on may 2011 for 180 euro...The price was very good..tha breakfast was not something special..but good enough..it was 15 min walk to Cornelia metro station..and with a ticket for three days on metro (11 euro)..everything was accesible very easy..if you have more money yes it would be better to stay in the historic center..if not this is the best choice for you..good price..next to metro station..with a breakfast that can hold you until night..enjoy rome..amazing city for a weekend break.. ...

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel but fair value”
Reviews.Author: JethroKent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a three night stay 12- 15th May 2011 - having read some of the previous comments about this hotel we were not looking forward to our trip one bit. In essence we found that this hotel was a basic no frills hotel; however, we did feel that we got good value for our money and had no problems whatsoever with rowdy students etc. This hotel is a bit far out from the city and takes approx 45 minutes from door to the centre of town on the Underground/Metro; however, please be aware that the gates on this line shut at 9pm whilst work/upgrades take place up until 2012. The bed was quite hard as previously stated but we had no problem with the water running cold in the shower. Okay the shower comes off the bath taps and you have a shower curtain etc; but overall this hotel is clean enough and the staff we met all seemed fine and polite enough. This hotel is nowhere near as bad as what some people have made out - its a no thrills but fair value for money hotel. Breakfast was fine with fresh rolls that do have a crust on them but are perfectly edible and not as some people have made out. Overall we were happy enough with our stay but would probably stay nearer the centre if we ever go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, does not show all that Rome has to offer”
Reviews.Author: jfay82
Reviews.Content: The hotel must be budget friendly (we stayed with a tour group so I'm not 100% sure) but after staying three previous nights in another Rome Hotel this was in stark difference. The hotel is large but budget. The beds and furnishings are old and in need of upgrading. There is some painting/renovation work happening. The shower water was cold if you showered late. That said, the hotel staff were quite n ice. The metro was a 10 minute walk, and from there the whole city was accessible. Breakfast was basic but fine. The TV reception for the english channels were very patchy.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!!!”
Reviews.Author: fussychef
Reviews.Content: As we were booking late for easter week this was the only hotel in our budget with vacancies. when we go back to Rome we will definately not be returning to this poxy hotel for the fillowing reasons!!.. 1. the noise levels. as has already been said the place is full of loud, obnoctious italian teenagers! i lost it on the first night and confronted them myself and they seemed to get the message hahaha!!! 2. the breakfast. hard rolls, prosessed ham and cheese, cheap cereals, disgusting coffee, revolting juice from a machine, dirty table clothes, dingy dining room, i could go on and on!! 3. decor and feel. very dated and delapidated! on our arrival the receptionist was having a joke with the owner about his new porsche... he would have been wiser to invest some of his (no doubt large) profits in updating his hotel! 4. location. the hotel is in no way central!! about its only redeeming feature is the fact that it is ten minutes walk from the metro, but with the current restrictions on the Metro this was a real pain. the last train back is at 9pm!!! 5. TV. ours didn't work very well at all!! 6. the room. our bed was rock hard with only one pillow each, the air con didn't work and the bathroom was shabby and grubby. all in all a very disappointing place to stay and i would never stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “This is not a hotel, It is like hell, do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimUK36
Reviews.Content: Dear friends, I am an honest person and I don’t want to destroy the image of this hotel but I really want to warren you about staying at Marc Aurelio hotel in Rome. DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL IF YOU WANT TO ENJOY YOUR STAY IN ROME. For these reasons: - This is not a 4 stars hotel; this is a 0 start hotel. Italian government (mafia) has decided to rank many hotels in Rome as 4 stars hotel to charge you Euro 3 per night per person for a city tax. Be aware!! - Every day a lot of students visit Rome, about 200/300 of them, most of them 12-18 years old boys/girls stay at this hotel every night. They make a lot of noises till 3:00-4:00 AM in the morning. They make a hell of your stay and you cannot sleep. Believe me, we did not sleep and we were very disappointed and tired. When we come back from Rome we were so tired and we slept one day. - Same student come to the restaurant to eat breakfast and they make a hell of your breakfast. I never forget how they behave in the restaurant. - Breakfast is very cheap and basic, bread is hard and a very bad quality, coffee is really a cheap quality. - Oh my God…the bed is very bad, noisy, and not comfortable at all. - I have stayed in many 4 start hotel in Europe and they have a free WIFI (internet) but here they charge you Euro 2 per half an hour!! - The hot water is NOT hot at all. It is just cold. It is really cold. - Air-condition does not work, if it is cold they turn it on. - Bathtub is very dirty and the lay there does not clean it. I asked another guest about it their bathtub was also very dirty with mold. I saw a cockroach in the bathtub, it was disgusting. I can write 10 pages about this bad hotel but this is enough to a smart person to forget about this 0 start hotel. Have a nice trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beware....before deciding to stay here !!”
Reviews.Author: kerrygibo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights from the 9th April 2011, and after reading some reviews we were a little apprehensive about our stay. We found the hotel basic, clean but dated. The beds were on the hard side, and yes you only get one pillow. The main issue here is the popularity of the hotel with school trips as one group leaves, another arrives. The group that arrived on our second night seemd to take over the whole floor, with constant running up and down corridors at all hours, in and out of each others rooms all made worse due to the extremely poor sound proofing of the rooms. We even had to unplug our phone as it kept ringing during the night. We did try and cut them some slack due to first night excitement, however this continued the following night. The hotel also is on a main road, which at first instance doesnt seem that busy, but if your room faces the road, with the poor windows you do feel that you are sleeping oposite the M6. We did hope to mention these issues when checking out, but the rude staff member on the desk at the time did not even have the coutesy to ask if we enjoyed our stay, he just groaned when we did not have cash to pay the tourist tax (3 euros per person per night) whilst being more concerned about dealing with some italian guests who were in reception at the same time. Breakfast is again basic, processed ham and cheese to go with some bread rolls, along with criossants and a selction of biscuits and jams. The orange juice is out of a machine, and the coffee is not very good. The hotel is at the top end of the metro, and about a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest station (be aware that until next year the A line you need to travel on has restrictions from Sunday-Friday and only runs until 9pm, when a bus service takesover), and does take you through a residential area close to the hotel and some shops further up by the metro station. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel if you want any sleep; it's a glorified youth hostel.”
Reviews.Author: Emlou590
Reviews.Content: Although this was not the most expensive hotel in Rome you would expect certain basics, such as the ability to get to sleep at night. I have never stayed in a hotel where the bed has been so uncomfortable that I couldn't sleep! The bed was so hard it was like sleeping on the floor. They issued one hard pillow and were reluctant to issue another one when asked. My biggest issue however was not the hard bed but the noise. What they do not tell you is that they are home to school trips which bring 50 Italian teenagers shouting and screaming down the corridor until early hours. We also had an incident where they were walking into our room! Of course I complained, the night porter tried to help and told me to write a letter of complaint on their headed paper. When I handed this in to the desk the next morning there was no apology. No one seemed to care as this continued every night of our stay. As one school left, another would arrive. The hotel was clean however, although on our arrival I did notice hair over the floor which was not ours. The bathroom was fine but the shower was not very powerful or hot. The breakfast was ok, plenty of cereal and drinks to suit. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the mono rail which makes getting to all the attractions very easy, although If I could do it all again I would book a hotel which was more central. Also, be aware of two important points. 1. It can cost you up to 90 Euros on a taxi fare to get to the hotel from the airport even if you do try to cut them down. 2. They will charge you 'ROME TAX' which is 3 Euros per person per day. Overall I was very disapointed with my stay here and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “does exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Maverick124
Reviews.Content: The Marc Aurelio is a 3 star hotel. What do you get when you arrive? exactly that, a 3 star hotel. No thrills, no luxuries no going the extra mile. But that's exactly what I expected from a 3 star hotel - i was neither dismayed nor over joyed. I got what a paid for. As mentioned the location is good, it's less than 5 minute walk from the station and only 3/4 stops from Vatican City, 7/8 from central terminus. I don't know why people are moaning that breakfast isn't cooked, it's in Italy and in a 3 star, so expect continental as that's the norm. Yes the selection wasn't great, I think there was 4 cereals on offer, croissants, bread rolls, ham and cheese. But what does this matter - when you go to Italy it's not the breakfast you're looking forward to but the long lazy lunches and dinners over looking the piazza's. The room was large, with plenty of space to store clothes etc. However the mattress was extremely stiff as were the pillows, so that could do with an upgrade. But the cleaner noticed we were using extra bedclothes to plump up our pillows and supplied us with an extra two without us asking - very observant! All in all, the Marc Aurelio is not going to be the best hotel you ever stayed at, but then when has a 3* hotel ever made that list? If you're back packing or doing a city break on a budget, this will be perfect for you. If you want luxuries, you'll need to dig a little deeper into your pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth sacrificing a central city location”
Reviews.Author: JCP2011
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel through a very cheap deal online, I had low expectations of what my money would be getting. My expectations were not heightened by reading other reviews on Trip Advisor. So, it really is saying something that even these low expectations failed to be met during my three-night stay last weekend. The beds were very uncomfortable - the double room was two singles shoved together. Hard matresses, rough blankets and old, lumpy pillows. The shower in the bathroom was OK - definitely the best (only good?) thing about this hotel. The maid service was good - well, standard really but still stood out in a hotel like this. The rooms were noisy and sounds from the rest of the corridor spread very easily - as did the noise from the main road outside which our room overlooked. The breakfast was rubbish. I didn't expect much from a continental buffet but the bread rolls were rock hard, the ham was that nasty 99% water processed stuff that I wouldn't even give to my cat, the coffee was from a machine and undrinkable - basically, italians should have been ashamed to serve it! However, I doubt the staff cared if their attitude towards showing people to a table (which didn't happen) or clearing dirty plates/cups from used tables (which only happened when I asked them to as there was no where else to sit) is anything to go by. The staff at the front desk were rude, almost immediately on arrival. This continued throughout the stay. On our final day, we were given a key to a luggage room to store our bags before our flight that evening. I may have been at fault as I took the key with us as I didn't know it was the only one. When we got back to the hotel to colect our bags, the man on reception actually yelled at me. Even if I was at fault, that reaction was totally unacceptable. The hotel is only 10 mins away from the centre of town and a 5 min walk from the Metro stop so this wasn't as bad as I had been expecting. The area is quite rough and I don't think a group of girls would feel safe walking back late at night alone. All in all, don't do it!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Metro”
Reviews.Author: Wedderburn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as part of a budget package, which was exceptional value. While I would have preferred to be more central, the hotel was a short walk from the station. The room was very clean the bed on the firm side and we slept well until builders started work somwhere in the hotel, so having a lie in was not successful. The staff were helpfull and knowledgable providing maps and directions. Breakfast, got there on the last day and for a continental selection I did not feel it was lacking, plenty of cereals, croissant, fresh bread, cheese, salami and ham. All replenished by helpful waiters. We got to the hotel via bus from Ciampino airport to Anangina, then metro to Cornelia thanks to a previous reviewer recommending this amazingly cheap option of 2 euros 20 cents each. Getting into Rome from The Marc Aurelio as a base was easy and a cab back from the centre was always around 15 euro. There is a great cafe nearby for brunch which served amazing italian fast food, called Luigi, Bar Tavola pizzeria on via Boccea 216. Full of locals enjoying home cooked food.

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: YellowPeril748
Reviews.Content: About a ten minute walk from the Metro, which once you know where you are, isn't a problem. One Euro per person gets you virtually anywhere you want to go in Rome. I didn't find the area threatening as some people have said, personally I've felt more frightened ion Birmingham! The worst point about the hotel is the evening bar food, supermarket budget pizza served on a plastic plate with plastic cutlery 10 Euros. However everything else was good. Staff friendly and helpful with no language barriers. Breakfasts typical of other French and Italian Hotels that I've experienced. A variety of cereals, bread rolls, croissants, jams, meats and cheeses and not quite so typical, supplies are constantly refreshed during the meal. coffees, hot chocolate, orange juice etc, via machines, Twinings teabags and hot water readily available. Room was clean, made up every day and shower nice and hot. Foe the evening we bought bread, cheese, snacks etc from supermarket and tooh them back to the hotel. I would say that for the money, very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, Only a train stop away from the major landmarks”
Reviews.Author: Nic_boycey1
Reviews.Content: I honestly don't know what some peoples problem is! The Marc'Aurelio is clean, spacious and extremely pleasant. The staff speak fine English and will assist you in whatever your need. Upon arrival they provide a map-which was indispensable to us!- and calling cards so you can get a cab back should you need one. They will tell you the nicer places to eat and where to go. The rooms are large with comfortable beds and an eb suite, the rooms are cleaned everyday and the mini bar is unusually cheap!! €2 for a can of peroni or a can of coke!! The hotel is near the Cornelia metro station which is only a few stops from the Vatican, Spanish steps, trevi fountain and other landmarks. The metro is so easy to use as there us only 2 lines. Overall I was extremely pleased with this hotel and would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in need of modernisation.”
Reviews.Author: dreabruge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Marc Aurelio Hotel for 4 nights during the last week of October. We booked a transfer from Leonardo DiVinchi Airport to the hotel which took about 20 minutes in fairly heavy traffic. We arrived at the hotel at 11:30am - before the checking in time of 2pm- but this wasn't a problem. We were checked in straight away, given some information about the area and a tourist map of Rome and then went straight to our room. The receptionist was very friendly and extremely helpful. His English was excellent. There are two lifts in the hotel which are a little dated, but functioned fine and were quick to call. Our room was on the 5th floor and was spacious and clean. The double bed was actually two singles pushed together so it was very spacious. Unfortunately the beds were a little hard for my liking and there was only one pillow each, with no spare. However, when our room was made up on the first morning the maid supplied us with extra pillows after noticing we had folded the extra blankets under the pillows on the bed. The heating is individually controlled in each room which was good on the colder nights and the bathroom was clean and functional. The location of the hotel was fine. It is a 10 minute walk to the nearest underground station, but it was very easy to find and most days I found I was at the station before I realised it! We bought out tickets from the newsagent across the road from the hotel - who spoke English very well. There is also a ticket machine at the station which costs the same (11Euros for a 3 day pass). Once on the metro train you are only 5 minutes from the first of the tourist destinations. The hotel was used by many coach tours during our stay (probably due to it's large car park) but the restaurant was large enough to cope with this and the food on the buffet breakfast was constantly restocked. Some people have said that there wasn't enough choice, but to be honest, I usually only have toast for breakfast at home, so having similar things each day didn't bother me. The breakfast was similar to all of the other 4 star hotels I have stayed at in Europe. Overall we really enjoyed our stay in Rome. The friendlyness and willingness to help of the staff at this hotel was second to none and with a little decor update, this could be an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant 10 nights”
Reviews.Author: Cracker_Chris
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel for 10 nights in July-August 2010. After reading many of the reviews on this site, I was very worried we made a terrible decision. The worrying was needless however, as the hotel was excellent. I'll break this review down into simple parts. Location Granted, the hotel is a fair distance away from both airports and the port, and a few miles from central Rome. The latter is pretty much a null point however, as the hotel is close to a major road which has buses going into and out of the centre pretty much every 5-10 mins. The hotel is also a 5-10 minute walk from the Cornelia Met.Ro station. The walk to the Met.Ro is quite pleasant (although there are open bins along the route, which sometimes smell). Some people have complained over this, but the bins disappear when you head out of the residential area and onto the main road (leading to the Met.Ro station) which is lined with shops and stalls. Overall I was pleased with the location of the hotel. Some people have suggested that it was "too far" from central Rome. This is nonsense. The Cornelia Met.Ro station is 4 stops from the Vatican (10 minutes) and around 9 to Termini (25 minutes). Rooms Our room was initially one with a double bed but we discovered these were 2 single beds placed together. As this is what we needed, we simple pulled them apart and had 2 singles. The room itself was clean and tidy, with no visible problems which were pointed out in earlier reviews. The bathroom was clean and the shower was pleasant in the mornings. Staff The staff at the hotel have been nothing but friendly and kind the whole time we were here. They'd happily fill any request we asked for, and spoke English very well. Not once did they ask us to repeat what we said. We also made an effort to use some Italian words, which we noticed were very well received. The room cleaning staff were also prompt and our room was always remade by the time we came back at around 4pm. The waiters in the restaurant downstairs in the mornings were also prompt at changing table sheets but didn't appear to know much English. Facilities The hotel has lifts which are quick and we didn't have any problems with them (an earlier reviewer critised them, no idea why). The hotel also has a bar down in the lounge which opens at 7:30pm. We found it to be a little expensive, but it's good for sitting down with a drink after a day in Rome to talk about what you'd done that day. The hotel also has 2 desktop PC's which you can use free of charge for word processing, but for the internet there is a small charge (e.g. 5 euros for 2hrs). They also offer a WiFi service for the same prices. I did try using the WiFi service in our hotel room but apparently it only allows login downstairs (even though there was a router right outside of our hotel room). It was slightly inconvient but nothing I was too annoyed with. I'd imagine you'd have better success logging in on a Netbook/Laptop. Overall I found this hotel to be a very nice place to stay for our time in Rome. The reviews by a lot of people here on TripAdvisor have been quite harsh to say the least, unless they had incredibly bad experiences or are just very picky. I'd definitely use this hotel again. It was a pleasure staying here and definitely deserves its 4 stars. The one thing I was quite disappointed about was the breakfast in the mornings. There were the same things on offer every morning, and after the 3rd breakfast it was quite bland and uninteresting. I found myself just having a bowl of cereal, cup of coffee and some juice then leaving. It would have been nice to see more variety. Nevertheless, I'd give the hotel a 4/5. You're sure for a pleasant stay here as long as you're not fussy and aren't expecting 5 star quality.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I was thinking”
Reviews.Author: dizzy1968
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this hotel I started to get a bit worried. But after spending 3 nights I could not be much happier with the rooms, service and how helpful the staff have been. It is nothing like the reviews I have read on here. Yes there is a bit of graffitti about but if you look it is all around in different places. The same as any or most capital cities. It is only a 10 minute walk to the metro to rome to get to the Vatican then after that it is all in walking distance. the metro is really easy to use. Breakfast is continental but there is still a choice of food. Air conditioning was brill as it was really hot through the night but lovely and cool in the rooms. If you dont mind the travel and looking on budget side this hotel is just the one. I was out with my daughter till 10 pm and felt safe walking around. Our rooms were clean and very well maintained by the staff. Staff answered any questioned we had. Reception has a lovely area to sit down and chill with a bar which is open about 5 or 6 in the evening. Enjoyed staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel advertised as a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: geordie58Newcastle
Reviews.Content: stayed in the marc aurelio for seven nights just after easter, the hotel was clean enough and about a ten minute walk from the nearest metro . breakfast was basic but o/k ,no tea or coffee making faciluties in room and the bar only opened at 7-30 at night,there is a mini bar in room where a small bottle of water was 1 euro 50. the hotel is 3 stops from the vatican and about 9 stops from central rome

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford to stay somewhere better, do.”
Reviews.Author: largo02
Reviews.Content: A taxi to this hotel from Leonardo airport was 45 euros. A train to Termini station in Rome and subway to Cornelia would have cost 13 euros per person but at night don't do it as you won't find the hotel easily and you will be scared when you get off the subway and try to make the ten minute walk to the hotel . The Marc Aurelia is in the middle of a very run down residential area with grafitti and dog pooh everywhere. The Hotel looks like it was built in the seventies and nothing has been done to it since. We stayed on the sixth floor and the wallpaper was hanging off the walls where it joined the extensively stained ceiling. It appeared the roof had leaked at some point. If we had had our three children with us I think my wife would have cried. As it was the room was clean, the sheets and towels were well laundered and the bathroom was okay. The hotel receptionist gave us an information sheet on arrival which included details of the nearest bus and subway stations. It also stated that bus/subway tickets could be purchased from the newsagent opposite. Don't buy them there! We paid 11 euros each for a 3 day travel pass only to discover that the shop owner had given us 1 day tickets valued at 4 euros. When we complained he just shrugged his shoulders and refused to give us our money back. We complained to the hotel receptionist who also just shrugged his shoulders. I asked for the police and was told there was no point contacting them. I was then given some single journey passes by the receptionist to get us back into Rome. This was very annoying. I would not stay here again but it was okay for a cheap trip.

Reviews.Title: “Less than average”
Reviews.Author: perthtravel_junky
Reviews.Content: Our faces began to drop as we got closer in the Taxi to the Hotel, graffiti increased, buildings started to have bars on the windows appear. Once in side the Hotel we felt like we had stepped into a time warp and had gone back to the 1970's, not sure anything has been done to the place since then, although the rooms did have new laminate wood floors, which where noisy but clean. The lifts where slow and we thought we would get stuck in them, when the doors opened to our floor we where greated by a foul smell we ran to our room not drawing breath until we where able to open our door and get away from the smell in the hall. The rooms where very basic, but were clean. The bed was very hard and sleeping on the metro chairs may have been more comfy. The aircon was old and should have been in a museum. It seemed to work a little until the hotel switched it off at 4am, the 1st night and then it stopped working altogether the next night. The hot water was also not working, not a good way to start the day. Opening the window was possible however made it very noisy and so difficult to sleep. the breakfast had a bit of selection, cereal, buns, croissants, cheese and ham, but not of a particularly good quality. And so we eat breakfast elsewhere the next 2 mornings. Hotel was relatively close (15min walk) to the Metro station, Cornelia, which was easy to navigate, however the walk to it along the footpath meant dodging dog poo and horrible, smells of garbage.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: silarem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights as it was part of a tour package. The room was very basic and sure the bathroom was a little run down. Breakfast was OK (breads and some cheese& ham). Internet is not free; I think it was 2 Euros per half an hour or more. There is a bar in the lobby and from what I heard drinks were expensive. The hotel is in a "rural" area of Rome and the closest metro is about 10 min walk. Overall I'll only stay in this hotel in the future if I found a good deal next time I'll stay closer to Rome "downtown". And remember the hotel is VERY basic not exactly a 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Greek travellers in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tsilis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days. It was located close to the metro station about 10 min away on foot. Very quiet place , not a luxury one but it was worth its money. Nice breakfast and helpful people at reception. The closest metro station is about 20 min from rome's central station. At night you can return by bus.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Besty76
Reviews.Content: I would not recomment this hotel to anybody. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Rome and were expecting 4 star but it was not anywhere near a 4 star. We found mould in the bathroom, along with plaster falling off the walls and the floor was extremely dirty. There was building works going on above on the next level with drilling starting at 7am and was still going on a 10pm at night to which we put in 4 formal complaints about the noisy building work in the middle of the night which were not addressed. I will comment that the breakfast was comparable to all other hotels that we stayed at but i still would not recommend this hotel. It is also not situated close to central Rome or the Vatican as it states. It is situated in the middle of the suburbs with only a few little shops situated nearby or any restaurants. I found that our complaints were not addressed and feel that we should have been notified of the building works/hotel fees reduced as having drilling above your head at 10pm at night on a holiday is really not good. Would not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Better than other reviews would have you believe!!!”
Reviews.Author: alicechadfield
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 3 nights in Rome staying at the Hotel Marc Aurelio. I feel that other reviews posted on this site do not do the hotel justice, or maybe the hotel has improved greatly since they were written. To be fair, the hotel is not in the centre of Rome. It is about a 20 minute journey, between walking and the metro, to get to the town centre. However, the hotel sits about 5-10 minutes walk from the closest metro station - Cornelia - and is 5 stops from the centre of the city. The service on the metro is reliable and fast and we didnt get pick-pocketed at all (although I hear it is quite common). The hotel is on metro line A which stops at the Vatican, Spanish steps, Trevi fountain and Pantheon, with most other attractions - Colosseum etc, within a comfortable walking distance. In general, it is pretty easy to get to all the attractions of Rome as long as you have a map (a good tourist map is provided by the hotel on check-in) and are wearing comfortable shoes! (A mistake I made on the first day!) The staff are friendly and speak very good English. They were more than happy to help whenever we had questions, and whilst the breakfast was simple and could have been fresher, it was definitely edible and provided much needed fuel for a long days sightseeing!!! The room itself was clean and spacious enough, with a reasonable mini-bar and ok views, and there were always clean towels and hot water (in contrary to what other travellers have written on this site!!) In our experience, the air conditioning was definitely not too noisy and very efficient!! The bathroom was equipped with both a shower and bath as well as a bidet which we definitely werent expecting! One thing that was a bit annoying was that the metro stops at 10pm most nights, but bus number 46 stops at the end of the road, as does night bus number 5 (depending on what time you decide to go home!!!) You can buy a 3 day metrebus (metro/bus) ticket for 11euros and then enjoy exploring the wonders of this gorgeous city!!! In general, I think that the hotel has been a bit under sold on this site and that really it was better than we had expected. The fact that it is a little way from town shouldn't put you off staying here, as long as you are able to walk a bit and have a bit of sense of adventure, its a pretty cool hotel. And much better than anything you could find in the centre of Rome for the same money!!! P.S. its not on any of the '10 must-visit places' but I would recommend that you go to the church San Marco, near the Monumento a Vittorio Emmanuelle, because it was beautiful and quiet and really cool inside and there weren't crowds of tourists destroying the atmosphere!!! Enjoy your holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Did not like this hotel or the area it is in.”
Reviews.Author: silverj
Reviews.Content: This hotel stated that they are situated near to the Vatican city, this is not so, it is a 10-15min walk from the hotel to Via Boccea where the number 46 bus stops, a three day Roma pass bus ticket can be bought across the road from the hotel for 11euros, the bus service is very good. Once you arrive at the bus stop, buses are frequent, it is about a 10min journey, then you must change to a number 49 bus, to be able to get off opposite the Vatican Museum entrance, this journey can take about 40mins might take longer depending on traffic. The restaurant, in the hotel, which only serves breakfast, has the same variety every day, namely very poor quality cornflakes, croiassants, and a kind of choux pastry roll, butter, small tubs of jam,tea and coffee. The room was spacious and clean, on the fifth floor facing the road which was very noisy about 6.00a.m., the air conditioning switches off about 1.30 in the morning. Other hotel users can be heard talking, coughing, laughing etc, well into the early hours. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and you cannot get a fresh cup of tea/coffee until 08.00a.m. when the breakfast room/restaurant opens unless you pay at a machine in the lobby, but no tea. The 2ft 6ins wide mattresses are on a sort of box and very hard, I put my mattress on the floor the second night with two folded blankets under to enable me to sleep I did ask at reception for a second mattress but they did not understand, they spoke very little english. The sheets were very clean and the thin tea towel linen type towels bath/face were changed every day, the sheets are not, the swimming pool was empty. If I were advising anyone where to stay I would suggest a hotel in the Cavour or Venezia area, then you are near to all the attractions but the Vatican making only one journey necessary and less expensive to travel, we had a taxi back to the vatican entrance one day, during rush hour, about three miles and it cost €18.97, as we had walked a long way and were exhausted, you need very comfortable footwear. There is litter and cigarette butts everywhere. We saw all the usual attractions which were awesome and incredibly beautiful, we joined a guide in a party of about 20 for the Vatican and Colessium which were excellant. We would not go back to Rome as it is very expensive and the restaurants do not cater for vegetarians only mundane/bland spaghetti.

Reviews.Title: “What a staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fairly speaking, it is confortable enough (I stayed there for 5 nights). Most staffs are nice. I got a large two-bed room although I booked a single one. The room is very clean. This hotel is a bit old, the air condition works but a bit noisy, and the room has poor sound insulation between adjacent rooms. The breakfast is ok. There is some little odor of tabacco or cigarette in the corridor and when you opening your room door, but tolerable (I guess the odor was attached on the carpet or wall). The light is dim everywhere. I highly suggest, if the manager see this review, that you should brighten your illumination in your room and your dining hall and your lobby, and renew all your carpets and wallpapers to remove the ordor and refresh the style. It is a 10-to-15-miniute walk to the metro, to the second from the last station of the line A, namely 'Cornelia'. The road where the hotel situated "via Gregorian XI" is in fact not a main line, so it is a dark walk when you come back from metro station to the hotel in the late night. But I think it is ok since it is in the resident region. At least I walk back safely every night. So the hotel is ok and I should give it 3 stars. But the following scene did happen one morning and reduced my rating of the hotel greatly. Here I cite verbatim: I, to the reception desk staff: "Can you do me a favor, to confirm the flight for me since the operators are all speaking italian?" The reply of the staff (impatiently): "No, you can do it yourself." As it is, he continued refusing to help. I was very surprised. Finally I tried to do it with the help of some others. I just dont know that, for a staff of a 3-star hotel, in Italy, is it a sin or shame to confirm the flights for your customer? Or in Italy the desk staff never did so? It should not happen in any hotel costing you 100 Euro per night, and should not happen in any staff of any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “is the hotel in the pic def this one?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Marc Aurelio hotel was not quiet the hotel that me and my friends expected. From the moment we checked in we could see that it would be a stressful time. The staff at the font desk could barely speak english. We finally got the keys to our room, and at first we were surprised at the fact that it was the old traditional key as opposed to the electronic entry system. The coridors had a pungent smell o them, the order was dirty and very off putting. Our room also had a unpleasent smell to it, but we thought if we put the air condonitioning on it my reduce the smell. This was immposible as the air con was not functioning at all, so the only option left was to leave the window open. The beds had no blankets in them, they only had sheets, we finally found the blankets on the floor inside the wardrobe. Once we opened the blanket we found a lot of hair in them and decided to not use them all together. The bathroom had no door lock on it. we decided not to let this bother our stay too much. when we tried to see if we could get our room changed we were told they were fully booked and it would be difficult. the restaurant area of the hotel also had a pungent odor to it and this put us off eating there. so we didnt not have breakfast at the hotel in the morning as the breakfast was just warmed up food. the safe in the room was not working so this meant us all carrying or passports and other valuble items with us at all times. There was also very little warm water when having showers in the morning. the hotel is quite far from the city centre and there is not information about any buses that can take you to the hotel. the walk from the metro station is about 15minutes. the hotel is at the second to last stop of the metro. The hotel is a fair distance from the Chiampino airport too, so tavelling to the hotel from the airport by taxi is expensive ( around 60 euros), and not many of the taxi drivers know where the hotel is situated exactly. Overall i would say the hotel is ok if one just wants a place to sleep at night and nothing else, and it's a bit too far from any of the tourist areas of rome the

Reviews.Title: “Close to Vatican City ?????”
Reviews.Author: CWLeics
Reviews.Content: Traveller from Leicester, England - Feb 2005 We arrived at the Marc Aurelio after walking around aimlessly from the Metro Station looking for the hotel for about 30 minutes. The hotel was very clean, and the staff were friendly. The bars on the bedroom window and the rubbish piled up outside left alot to be desired. Breakfast was ok, pretty standard continental breakfast. A bit dissapointing that the 'relaxing' American bar was not open, which would have been well worth it for the hotel in our opinion, as it was too far to walk to any decent bar or restaurant. The air conditioning is absolutely dreadful, it comes on when it wants too, even when the room is already very cold. It is also extremely loud, especially at 5am in the morning. The hotel states it is close to the Vatican City, if you call 5 stops on the Metro close, then you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “too far from rome”
Reviews.Author: maggiannLeicester
Reviews.Content: looked very nice from front ,rooms very clean but beds small much too far from centre of rome and no bar in the hotel towels very thin also, but worst of all was the very noisy air conditioning system which made sleep almost impossible would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “air con. no way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It seemed miles away from city on the bus along very clogged streets. Breakfast not very good. Air con. did not work very hot. Noisy. Staff friendly Plumbing dreadful .

Reviews.Title: “Did not like it....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel march of 2003 and i would not stay there again. the rooms were small and the bathrooms flooded everytime we used it so we ran out of towels everytime. the staff were nice but i wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “THEY CALL IT A RESTAURANT!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dissapointed with the hotel facilities.Swimming Pool,surrounded with an equally dirty and broken patio. was a dirty broken up heap-without water. The Restaurant was not run by the Hotel but was franchised and was dreadful. The breakfast was put out,overnight,frozen,and was thawed and very chewy by breakfast time.Coffee was not fresh but came ,lukewarm from a very questionable machine.Dinner,on request,was dumped in front of you on a take it or leave it basi Hotel staff were friendly and helpful withn the exception of those in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Looks a bit basic from the outside but this hotel has a nice reception area, the people are nice and courtious and the room was clean and adequate enough for a week in Rome, although the double bed was two single matresses which was a bit annoying. It is situated a bit far from the nearest metro station but the location of the area seemed good and free from trouble and felt safe to walk at night. Would recommend definitely.

HotelInfo.Name: Marc Aurelio Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Gregorio XI 141, 00166 Rome, Italy
